page.title: 10ROSSENDALE FREE PRESS
page.content: The Rossendale Free Press was established on 10th March 1883 and for over 100 years has been based at its present site in Bank Street, Rawtenstall. Although called the Free Press it has never been free of cost. It was called the Free Press because its columns were supposedly open to all shades of opinion. The Free Press is owned by the Rochdale Observer Group and is published in Rochdale. It costs eighteen pence and is on sale each Saturday throughout the Rossendale Valley. News articles concentrate on all items of local concern. Photographs accompany many of the main stories and there are sections devoted to advertisements, entertainment, sport, childrens activities, births, deaths and weddings.
